questions.text: Why was Diane in such a good mood today?
questions.correct: She believed today was the day Sam would propose.
options: She enrolled in a new class at school.
questions.explanation:
She believed today was the day Sam would propose.

	Sam said she said everyday that he would propose and she said "But I never said this, it's today." Sam was getting rather annoyed with her constantly saying he'd propose.

Sam.

	Sam made jokes about Diane saying he'd propose today. He at one point said "Will you marry...me buddy Norm."

questions.text: Who told Sam, "Don't ever make fun of a woman when she says she has a feeling about something"?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Carla was scared that Sam would indeed propose to Diane that day. She tried to keep it from happening as best she could because she loved Sam but hated Diane.

Tom.

	Tom was played by Thomas W. Babson. Babson was born in 1945. He started his professional acting career in 1977.

questions.text: What did Sam tell Diane that made her cry?
questions.correct: He would never propose to her.
questions.explanation:
He would never propose to her.

	Sam asked to see Diane alone. She thought he was going to propose. When he said he'd never propose she started to cry which made Sam propose to her.

questions.text: When Sam proposed to Diane when she was crying what did she say?
questions.explanation:
No.

	This caused Sam to become angry. He had a vision of himself getting the death penalty.

questions.text: Why did Sam envision himself getting the death penalty?
questions.explanation:
for killing Diane.

	Sam asked the priest in his little daydream if he believed in the afterlife. The priest said "Yes my son I do." Sam replied, "Good I can find her there and get her again."

questions.text: At the time of this episode, did Massachusetts have the death penalty?
questions.explanation:
no.

	Sam told Diane about his vision that he got the death penalty for killing her. Diane told him there was no death penalty but she was going to campaign for it.

questions.text: What did Diane call Sam that upset him at the trial?
questions.explanation:
the accused.

	"Sam. My name is Sam. Ask her to say my name." Sam said when he got angry. Diane then started to call him Sam.

questions.text: Do Diane and Sam get engaged?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Sam had a choice, he could either propose to Diane or go to jail. Sam proposes the first time and Diane said it wasn't sincere. The second time she accepts. Then as they are leaving she told him he didn't have to marry her since he was forced to propose. Sam told her, "They can stop me from killing you, but they can't stop me from marrying you."
